concept.title: Validation
concept.shortdesc: The provides two types of validation:

dlentry.dd: Static validation occurs by default as the console saves your changes. Static validation lists missing or incomplete configuration, such as an unconnected stage or a required property that has not been configured.
Errors found by logical validation display in the Issues list. Stages with a static validation error display an error icon.
Semantic validation occurs on demand when you click the Validate icon, run data preview, or start a pipeline. Semantic validation becomes available when logical validation passes.
Semantic validation checks all configured values for validity and verifies whether the pipeline can run as configured.
For example, while static validation verifies that you entered a value for a URI, semantic validation tests the URI by connecting to the system.
